s0076: The Shang ancestor Yi heard of this and was afraid, reported it to Emperor Zhou.
s0077: Zhou said: 'Is there not the Heavenly Mandate?
s0080: The next year, attacked Chong Hou Hu.
s0081: He built Feng city, moved the capital from Qi below the mountain to Feng.
s0082: The next year, defeated the Qi state.
s0083: King Wen died, King Wu ascended.
s0084: King Wu made the Duke of Zhou prime minister, and the Duke of Shao assistant.
s0085: He prepared troops, observed the stars and constellations, chose an auspicious day.
s0086: King Wu reviewed the troops at Mengjin.
s0087: The Shang king Zhou heard of this and laughed, saying: 'The western barbarians are few.'
s0089: King Wu crossed the Yellow River at Mengjin with 800 lords.
s0090: The next day, engaged in battle at Muye.
s0091: The Shang troops were numerous, but the Zhou troops were resolute.
s0092: The Shang troops all turned against Zhou, and Zhou was defeated.
s0093: King Wu entered the Shang capital, the city of Zhao.
s0094: He captured the treasures of the Yin Shang, returned to Fenghao.
s0095: He divided the lands, enfeoffed the Zhou lords.
s0096: He put the Duke of Zhou in charge of the eastern regions.
s0097: King Wu died, King Cheng was young, the Duke of Zhou acted as regent.
s0098: The three guards rebelled, the Duke of Zhou put down the rebellion.
s0099: He moved the Yin people to Luo, established the eastern capital.
s0100: He made the Luo Proclamation, established the well-field system.
s0101: He made the various lords swear oaths.
s0102: King Cheng grew up, the Duke of Zhou returned the government.
s0103: King Cheng went to the eastern capital, toured the lords.
s0104: The lords all came to court, no one dared to be late.
s0105: King Cheng returned to Fenghao, was diligent in government.
